alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 16 at 2:10PM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and at least a brief period of wintry mix. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible across much of the area, and ice accumulations up to around one tenth of an inch possible along the southern end of the watch area. Winds will average 15 to 25 MPH out of the north-northeast. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions may develop in time to impact the Wednesday morning commute, but there is greater confidence in impacts to the Wednesday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With this winter storm still at least 36 hours out, please expect at least minor, if not somewhat significant adjustments in later snowfall forecasts, as confidence levels in snow amounts at any given location is currently considered only medium. This is due continued uncertainties in exact storm track, and location of sharp transition from heavy snow to wintry mix.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
